DBD is a 4v1 game with a community the likes of which even League of Legends wishes it could be as toxic as. 'OP KILLERS! OP SURVIVORS! ITS NOT THAT THEY'RE BETTER THAN ME!' Really they just were and everyone of you is a salty clam.
Good news though ladies, gentlemen, and hillbillies in my attic! They've partially fixed Matchmaking so its not constantly rank 20s against rank 1s, and crossplay has made the endgame chat as quiet as can be! The toxicity can't slap you, me, or any other casual player who just wants to enjoy shanking survivors with a murder weapon, or surviving said murder weapon. Therefore raising my old thoughts on this game from a 7 to 9 out of ten. Woop woop! The only thing to make you mad now is your own mediocrity and bad luck.

Though I will say, if you do want to play this as a sweaty boi and are solo, play killer. Doing survivor without friends is fairly difficult and the higher in the ranks you go, the harder it gets to be a solo lad and your teammates act like idiots(But its really just cause no one can communicate without Discord/Xbox party/whatevs).

Don't believe what my hours say by the way, i've played at least twice that amount of time in offline mode, and i've had this game for a while.

lo que voy a decir es va a ser mi (Opinión) sobre las horas que llevo y con lo que me encontré en este juego jugando solo con randoms o con amigos y jugando de killer

es otro juego mas , donde va a ver gente troll o toxic@s etc .
en este caso Dead by Daylight . por una parte de survivor que te farmea en la cara o se pone a trolear la partida para perder aveces o se le pasan como ninjas y no quieren aparecer en toda la partida para ayudar en algo.

por otra parte de killer que directamente al primero que cuelga ya lo va a campear y tunelear aveces o si ve que le va muy mal en una partida y le estan rusheando los motores rapido al que atrape lo va a campear en la cara hasta que acabe muerto en el gancho etc

que es lo que veo que escucho de la GENTE decir mucho 
 Survivor : Camper . tunelero etc 
Killer : me rusheado los motores rapido . son Premades me van a trolear , gente toxica etc

pero que es lo que veo YO : exactamente lo mismo que dicen la gente . "PERO" en ningun lado dice que no se puede hacer tal cosa , en el juego no te dice que no lo podes hacer nada , asi que si se puede campear y tunelear y rushear motores y trolear al killer etc aun que mucho no les guste  .

por algo hay perks en casos de camper o tuneleros 
por algo hay perks contra gente que son premades o rushear los motores rapido
pero uno nunca se sabe si en la siguiente partida les va a toca esa gente o no y siempre en la mayoria de los casos estan obligados a llevar esas perks por si acaso 

si uno va a compra el juego y a va a aprende como jugarlo , una vez que ya sepa , va a jugar como esa persona quiera jugarlo a su modo por que le gusta asi , es asi de simple

para mi el juego esta bien , los asesinos que hay y tanto de peliculas que son algunos y tambien de los survivors , pero si te toca esta tipo de gente en una partida no te pongas mal , yo lo tomo como un desafio cada vez que me toca esta tipo de gente y se aprende mucho la verdad para jugarles mejor tanto de que vallas de survivor o killer

pero como dice al principio , es mi (OPINION) y (LO QUE PIENSO) respecto con lo que me encontre en este juego y las horas que llevo jugando .

lo unico malo que yo veo , son siempre los bugs o bugs nuevos que te vas a encontre muchas veces , en mi caso ya me paso varias cosas
mi nota : 8,5

Game is great if you are a sweaty casual who likes horror themes and you want competitive game with depth and grind. Be prepared to drop 15 - 30 extra dollars to unlock characters and perks you like.

Pros
+Unique asymmetric game with depth on both sides.
+Fun for casuals and sweaty casuals.
+Lots of characters and perks to play with and learn. There are many recognizable characters from other franchises.
+Start with some strong characters on both sides, and you can e v e n t u a l l y unlock characters/perks/many cosmetics with in game currency.
+Fun community and lots of streamers to watch to get better.
+Game gets frequent updates and has frequent events. The tomes (quest tree events) stay forever and can always be filled out for extra bloodpoints.

Cons
-Game can be buggy and scuffed sometimes, which can be frustrating.
-Not for e-athletes. The best strategies are often not the fun strategies, there is a lot of chaos, and there is a casual culture surrounding the game.
-The grind is long, and can not be avoided. (no pay to skip). If you want to get into the meat of the game, be prepared to sink at least 80 hours. (Low level play is still fun, but you will be missing some perks you want.)
-While you can grind out characters, there is a lot of grind in the game already. With the amount of time you will spend playing it is better to drop some money early and grind with the characters you like.
-Many maps and other parts of the game are questionably balanced.

Dead by Daylight is one of those games you plan to play for maybe a month after you bought it. But it's one of those games you can keep coming back to and it surprisingly never gets old. 

I played this game for about a month with a friend of mine but then I actually took the time to learn the game. I watched streamers and looked up builds for my survivor. I continued to play survivor until I felt happy about where I was on the ranking system. Then I began playing killer.

Playing killer is like playing a whole brand new game. Each killer is completely different from one another. I originally played Hillbilly in lower ranks, then I bought Myers because I was a fan of the Halloween franchise, then I watched Stranger Things and began to play Demogorgon. Each killer has a brand new feel to them and I praise this game over it. 

Some things I don't like about the game though is how long it takes for bugs/balancing to be patched in. It's a whole process with going to the PTB (Public Test Build) and sits there for roughly 2 weeks with barely anyone playing. Ranking/MMR is also an issue but I don't even know how to fix it in this type of game. 

Overall, I love this game and have recommended it to a number of my friends. If I had to give it a rating based off of how I feel to this day about Dead by Daylight I'd say: 8/10

So heres the thing about this game. It's fun especially if you're knew. You may get scared a few times or it might get your heart racing but that doesn't last long. And then the game becomes more competitive and then you start to worry about metas an other BS. The game does keep adding cool and unique characters, especially the killers, since at the end of the day, survivors are almost just cosmetics anyways. Most fun through this game can be found through playing with friends. But if you end up liking killer more, than you won't have many of those. With the new addition of crossplay the game becomes much easier in higher ranks, since console players can't react as fast and can't turn and aim as fast either. Of course  you can always turn it off. But having the addition of cross play is nice if you have friends who are strictly on console. Overall, I enjoy my time with this game, and I always look forward to the new killers and survivors they add next, even if it may seem like they are running out of new killer powers. I give this game a solid 8/10

This game garbage for both sides. Killer you could stab a person and they dead hard away, even though your weapon is in them. For survivor, you can literally vault a window land safely on the other side and still some how the hit will register. Even after being safe on the other side and away from the window. Your DS could glitch if the killers lagging. You could sit through a whole game where everyone is moried off the first hook, get to the end of the match have it error and you get nothing. That's just some of the problems on here. This game is horrible and I hope sinks like the Friday the 13th game. Save yourself the time, money, and frustration. NOT WORTH IT!

Par où commencer ? On peux renommer ce jeu "Dead by Frustration" ce sera plus simple. Be Haviour nous offre là une des expériences de jeu en ligne les plus déséquillibrées jamais vue à ce jour. 

Jouer Survivant peux s'avérer être un vrai plaisir quand l'équipe communique via un salon vocal externe au jeu. 

Jouer Tueur, c'est là tout autre chose. A partir d'un certains Rang, il est impossible de gagner face à une équipe bien soudée. Sans compter les perks des survivants qui sont bien trop forte. (Je vous laisse deviner le résultat d'une partie face à 4 idiots avec "Drôlement dur, Coup décisif, Sur la réserve & Adrénaline"). 

On peux vite énoncer les tueurs inutiles : La Légion, Leatherface (quand bien même s'il à été up par la suite) & Le Piégeur destiné à jouer un build centré sur la cave pour gagner avec un goût amer. Et les survivants qui déconnectent vous faisant perdre pas mal de points !

Les autres tueurs hormis l'Esprit, Billy (nerf) et la Harpie peinent à s'en sortir. Cela dépend évidemment de votre style de jeu. Privilégier un build cancérigène de préférence, il ne faudrait pas varier son gameplay ! Quelle idée !

Jouer tout court c'est également compliqué par moment. Be Haviour se démène de nous inventer de nouveaux bugs à chaque mise à jour (ils en plaisantaient dans les écrans de chargement de l'événement Dead by Daylight 4th anniversary, c'est tout bonnement incroyable une telle incompétence après 4 années !)

Entre les bugs de hitbox, l'action d'attraper les survivants pendant une action qui s'annule (et parfois vous rend immobile pendant le restant de la partie... ouais.)

Les déconnexions soudaine ? Qui vous font perdre vos Offrandes & vos Items ?  Y'en a pour tout les goûts !

Les reports ? Ce sont l'équivalent des impôts irl : on ne sait pas ou ils vont. 

Il est triste de voir une telle idée de jeu si mal exécutée.
Just don't play this game. If your friends tell you to play it, just don't.
